result.execSummary:
The defendant Kimberly Marie McCarthy was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed
supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: STRAIGHT TIME, consecutive to any other sentence.

miscConds.notes: *   Restitution is set at $249.99 payable to Target.
*   Pay all mandatory costs, fees, surcharges and restitution by 9/25/2018. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.
*   Obtain and maintain part time work no less than 20 hours per week.

*   Mental Health Evaluation and take ALL prescribed medication, and/or any treatment deemed appropriate.
*   Successfully complete any other counseling and/or treatment deemed appropriate.

*   Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment and successfully complete recommended treatment.
*   Maintain absolute sobriety.

records.descr: Notice of court ordered financial obligations
Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Letters on behalf of Kimberly McCarthy, received and filed.

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.

Defendant sentenced to serve 4 MONTHS (STRAIGHT TIME) in the House of Correction, consecutive to any other sentence. COURT STAYED THE SENTENCE and placed the defendant on probation with the State of Wisconsin, Department of Corrections for a period of 12 MONTHS.

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:
     *   Mental Health Evaluation and take ALL prescribed
          medication, and/or any treatment deemed appropriate.      
     *   Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment
          and successfully complete recommended treatment.
     *   Maintain absolute sobriety.  
     *   Successfully complete any other counseling and/or
          treatment deemed appropriate.
     *   Pay all mandatory costs, fees, surcharges and restitution
          by 9/25/2018. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.
     *   Restitution is set at $249.99 payable to Target.
     *   Obtain and maintain part time work no less than 20 hours per week.

Notice of Right to Seek Post-Conviction Rights and Restitution Worksheet, received and filed

Defendant Kimberly Marie McCarthy in court with attorney Charles Robert Roozen.  Jennifer L Pickett appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  

Defendant changes her plea to GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to her plea, advised of her Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty.   Defendant advised that if not a United States Citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found that defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived her rights.  Guilty Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea.  Court found defendant guilty and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.

Defendant Kimberly Marie McCarthy in court with attorney Charles Robert Roozen.  Kristyn R Kuzniar appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case in court for plea hearing. Defense counsel requests more time to review. Court ordered case adjourned for plea and sentencing in Branch 47.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 25, 2017 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Kimberly Marie McCarthy in court with attorney Charles Robert Roozen.  Kristyn R Kuzniar appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case in court for status conference. Defense counsel requests a projected guilty plea date.   Parties are advised effective July 29, 2017 case is assigned to Judge Kashoua Kristy Yang in Room 623 of the Courthouse.  Plea hearing scheduled for August 22, 2017 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Kimberly Marie McCarthy in court with attorney Charles Robert Roozen.  Kristyn R Kuzniar appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case in court for pre-trial conference. Defense counsel requests more time to review. Court ordered case adjourned for status conference in Branch 47.  Status conference scheduled for July 7, 2017 at 01:30 pm.

Court ordered Justice Point Pretrial Services LEVEL 2 SUPERVISION.   
Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with the Target store located at 2600 South 108th Street, West Allis, WI.

Defendant Kimberly Marie McCarthy in court with attorney Charles Robert Roozen.  Defendant Kimberly Marie McCarthy in custody.  Karine O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  JKF.   Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Siefert, Branch 47.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for June 26, 2017 at 01:30 pm.

Prior: 711 E Forest Hill Ave, Oak Creek, WI 53154
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
